intro: Ruellia spiciflora, commonly known as the spiked ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of blue or purple, which are arranged in spikes along the stem. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture. Ruellia spiciflora is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive flowers and adaptability to various growing conditions.
